definitions.definition: to separate something from other things with which it is connected or mixed:
examples: A high wall isolated the house from the rest of the village.

definitions.definition: to keep a person or animal separate from other people or animals by putting them in a different place:
examples: He was isolated from all the other prisoners.

definitions.definition: to put a person, country, or organization in a situation where they are seen as being separate :
examples: This policy will isolate minority groups and prevent integration.
